description: Astalaxmi Shakya is a Nepalese politician who served as the Chief Minister of Bagmati Province, becoming the first woman in Nepal to hold such a role. Her political career began in her youth, leading her to join the CPN-ML in 1980 by going underground. She has held several ministerial portfolios, including Minister for Women, Children and Social Welfare (2004–2005) and Minister for Industry (2008–2009). Shakya was elected to the House of Representatives in 1999 and later served in the Constituent Assembly. She also serves as the vice-president of the Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist–Leninist).
short_description: Nepalese politician and former Chief Minister of Bagmati Province, notable for being the first woman to hold a chief minister position in Nepal.
